summary: Seasoned musician Jackson Maine discovers -- and falls in love with -- struggling artist Ally. She has just about given up on her dream to make it big as a singer until Jackson coaxes her into the spotlight. But even as Ally's career takes off, the personal side of their relationship is breaking down, as Jackson fights an ongoing battle with his own internal demons.

reviews.content: Um filme bem tocante, por mais que seja uma regravação, porém a qualidade dele realmente aumentou muito diante ao antigo. Sem contar que gerou a clássica música da Lady Gaga. Realmente um filme muito bonito que eu recomendo a todos a assistir. Ele é muito interessante e foge bastante da questão de documentario.
A deep dive into an alcoholic’s promotion of a super talent.
The most magical 2.25 hours ever!!!!!!!!!! Starring Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper as singers and lovers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

One of the worst movies Ive ever seen. Gaga is a Bow Wow. i couldn't wait to get out of the theater, the movie was so bad it was downright creepy.  Ugh. What else is there to say? Maybe just this: The 1954 version was ok, it was a watchable movie. the 1976 version was lousy. This version is awful and then some. So the trend seems to be that the remakes keep getting worst, and worse, and worse. How low can they go? Stay tuned!
Eh...fast-forwarded tragic love story, that felt, well....fast forwarded.
Brilliant film. Has you on the edge of your seat and getting frustrated when things aren't going the way you wanted them to! Very sad but amazing film and music too.

Amazingly boring. So Gaga can sing and act (probably why she was assigned the leading role). And Cooper can play the guitar. Wow? Two talents... who would have thought.

Maybe it would have helped if I was into the music. I admire Gaga a lot, but the music  in ASIB is so soft and harmless and "edgeless" that I quickly got tired of listening to it.

Bereft of the music, the movie shows her singing and him getting drunk for 2 hours and 10 minutes. 2 hours of waiting for a plot twist. The ending almost felt liberating.

If you consider yourself somewhat a cynic or just expecting more than sobbing romance, leave this movie to people who appreciate grandiose romantic movies. And musical movies.

Very Endearing I have to say that I had a hard time getting into this movie. I found the opening to be cliched and silly. I did not like Bradley Cooper's performance. Very quickly the worm turned. This is an endearing and engaging film that is so comfortable that you feel like you really, really know these characters. Bradley Copper is a great Director and his Kristofferson-like performance is great. Lady Gag is so amazingly talented-not just musically but dramatically, well. Sam Elliott and Andrew Dice Clay are great in supporting roles. Dave Chappelle is so touching and good that it is mind boggling. This is a remake, but it is also an original. The music is good. It is long, but that is ok. It took me awhile to watch it but I am glad I saw it.

"A Star is Born" is a romantic musical drama released in 2018, directed by Bradley Cooper, who also stars in the film alongside Lady Gaga. The movie follows the story of a seasoned musician, Jackson Maine (Cooper), who falls in love with a young aspiring singer named Ally (Gaga) and helps launch her career while struggling with his own personal demons.

One of the strongest aspects of "A Star is Born" is the outstanding performances by Cooper and Gaga. Cooper showcases his acting and singing skills, delivering a powerful and nuanced portrayal of a troubled musician struggling with addiction and fame. Gaga, known for her vocal prowess, also impresses with her acting, bringing depth and vulnerability to the character of Ally. The chemistry between the two leads is palpable and adds to the emotional impact of the film.

The movie's soundtrack is also a highlight, with catchy and emotional songs that serve as a powerful storytelling tool. The music captures the rawness and authenticity of the characters' experiences and emotions, adding an extra layer of depth to the film.

The cinematography and direction by Bradley Cooper are also noteworthy. The film's visual style is immersive and captures the essence of the music industry and the characters' journey. The direction is sensitive and nuanced, allowing the story to unfold in a natural and organic way.

However, one of the weaknesses of the film is its pacing. At times, the movie can feel slow and drawn-out, particularly in the second half, and some scenes could have been trimmed or edited down to create a tighter narrative.

Overall, "A Star is Born" is a powerful and emotionally engaging romantic musical drama that showcases the talents of its cast and crew. While it may have some pacing issues, the film's outstanding performances, excellent music, and impressive direction make it a must-see for fans of the genre.
